intro: Zieria distans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zieria, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Zieria distans is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
